availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
District of Columbia
County of Washington } SS

I, William Fitch duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, resident in the City of Washington in the District of Columbia do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner, under and by virtue of the laws of the State of Kentucky

figure.ab: SUPREME COURT OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA

body.p: Sworn to and Subscribed before me this 17th day of June A D 1863

R. J. Meigs,
Clerk of the Supreme Court of the District of Columbia.

My official Seal
William Fitch
Comr of Deeds for the State of Kentucky

District of Columbia
Oath of Wm Fitch
Comr of Deeds
Filed June 22d 1863
